humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: Based on the pathology report, one out of the five sentinel lymph nodes (4/5 or 1/1) has metastatic carcinoma. This corresponds to N1 stage according to the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes). Additionally, the synoptic report states 'Lymph node status: Positive 1/13', which also supports the N1 stage. The report does not mention in-transit, satellite, or micrometastases, or ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes, so we cannot apply N3 or N2 criteria. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has one sentinel lymph node (#4) positive for metastatic carcinoma with extranodal extension, and eight additional lymph nodes negative for metastases. This corresponds to pathologic N1 stage.
